Summary: 3 objects moving very slowly at high alt. N->S
trends: There have been 5 other sightings in Twinsburg
There were no other sightings in Twinsburg on or around April 22nd 2007
divs: sighting detailsnice evening. sat outside to look at stars and satellites. saw one satellite moving s to n around 2200 that did brighten momentarily, and another satellite moving w to e at about 2215. shortly after saw what i believed to be another moving n to s. kept my eye on it to see if it would brighten when it caught me as moving slower than any satellite (or a\c) that i had observed prior. that's when i noticed there were actually three objects in a lazy left-handed "l" formation moving together. again emphasis on how slowly they were moving. if one wasn't looking closely they would blend in without a second thought. called to my kids but by the time they had the binos out they had faded in the distance. i know what i saw. these lights were not aircraft or satellites or a space station. again, three moving in unison at a pace so slow they were barely noticeable.
